subject: Management
title: Setting Authority Levels
description: A 60-second lesson on Setting Authority Levels.

hook.text: An employee made a $50,000 decision the manager didn't authorize. Both were right to be upset.

buildup.text: Delegation without clear authority is a recipe for either paralysis or overreach.

discovery.text: Use authority levels: act and inform, recommend and wait, or research and present options.

twist.text: Most handoff conflicts aren't about competenceâ€”they're about unclear authority.

climax.text: Stating 'you can decide up to X, escalate beyond that' prevents surprises.

punchline.text: Define the sandbox before someone plays in it.

quiz.question: Why should authority levels be explicitly stated during delegation?
options: To prevent paralysis or unauthorized decisions
To ensure the manager stays in control
